abstract: Increasing numbers of anti-immigrant demonstrators in Dresden, Germany, sparks both sides of immigration issue in Germany and restarts debate about national identity; protesters see egregious effect of foreigners, particularly Muslims, on society; academics say 'rift runs through society.'
lead_paragraph: The marches in Dresden have galvanized both proponents and opponents in Germany and raised anew a question the country has long grappled with: Who is German?

byline.original: By ALISON SMALE and MELISSA EDDY

snippet: The marches in Dresden have galvanized both proponents and opponents in Germany and raised anew a question the country has long grappled with: Who is German?

headline.main: Anti-Immigration Movement in Germany Reignites Debate Over National Identity
headline.print_headline: Anti-Immigration Movement in Germany Reignites Debate Over National Identity
